The service was very friendly and the rooms, & common areas were very clean. But what we liked the most was the location. Obviously good for our daughter, but we were able to plan an outing every day with the kids that was easy to get to. Many attractions were within 5 miles, & we could take the local streets & avoided the busy highways. We went to the zoo, Sea World, toured the Midway Aircraft Carrier, Old Town (for dinners), and Balboa Park (went to several museums there). We LOVED it all!! We did drive about an hour north one day to go to LegoLand-it was OK. The beaches, particularly the ones in La Jolla , were also an easy drive- which we did several time. If you're traveling with kids this hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids”
Reviews.Author: angellovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at this resort and we were very happy with it. We stayed in a 1-bedroom that was small but the layout worked for us. We're used to staying at Marriott timeshare and this is WAY smaller, but still decent. There was a small kitchen and separate living room area. We loved that there was a little kid's corner in the lobby/dining area where our kids could sit, eat, and watch movies that we could borrow from the front desk. The breakfast was nothing exciting, but it was free and it was close, but it got really busy past 8 am. The pool was exceptionally warm... really nice. There are LOT'S of kids here, so if you don't want to be around children, this isn't your place. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “We Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: jreilly2010
Reviews.Content: Our family just finished a week's stay at this hotel. We won't be back. Our stay started with our having to wait to check in while the hotel clerk finished a personal call at the front desk and went down hill from there. Our room was not particularly clean and in addition to groceries out trip to the supermarket after arriving included purchasing cleaning supplies to deal with what the Housekeeping staff missed. We understood this condition better at the end of the week since housekeeping did not attend to our room on two of our seven days at the facility. The hotel was also pretty noisy, but it was full most of the time so some of that is to be expected. What was unexpected was the hotel running out of parking spaces, particularly annoying since we were charged $10 / night to park. "Business center" printing facilities also did not work when we needed them. Had to get the front desk to print boarding passes, etc. In all, and considering we used Marriott Reward points for our stay, we're really disappointed. I would advise friends to avoid the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Spread Out" is their motto and we enjoyed the family suite”
Reviews.Author: GeckoMom
Reviews.Content: Pros - clean, spacious family suite with well equipped kitchen - micro, big frig, 2 burners, dishwasher, toaster oven, and table for 4. Our active kids enjoyed the bunk beds and it is really a two bedroom with large main area to run around in. Also liked the 3 tvs and pool and spa area. Convenient location in hotel circle - close to lots of attractions and downtown. Staff and other guests were pleasant. Cons - full breakfast was not that tasty and a mob scene if you did not arrive very early and there are no trays to carry it to room. For the price plus $10 parking and $25 taxes per day, it was pretty basic - no flat screens, comfy comforters, great landscaping, or other upscale elements. Also, the only bathroom is in the king bedroom. We spent a lot of time at local attractions and didn't really use the kitchen, but you could save a lot of money on meals if you cooked there. Not sure it was a great value since we didn't spend much time there, but we generally liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: cohoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn for two days on vacation with three children, and I used my Marriott Rewards points for two separate rooms. The hotel is conveniently located on Hotel Circle South Road very close to Sea World, Mission, Pacific, and Ocean Beaches. It was the perfect place for my family to rest after our adventures to Sea World and the beaches. Checkin was a breeze and the desk clerk and staff were wonderful. The room we stayed in had a separate bedroom off a living/kitchen area, and my sister-in-law's room had two separate bedrooms (one with a King bed and the other with two bunkbeds for kids). Each room was very quiet, roomy, and clean. Being a Residence Inn, both rooms also had a full-sized refrigerator, electic stovetop, and sink. Although the hotel didn't have an adjacent Restaurant on the premises, they did offer food delivery via a local Italian Restaurant (which we ordered one evening, and was very good). The hotel does have vending machines for sodas, water, and ice cream. During happy hour (6:30-7:30p?) the hotel served beer on tap, sodas, and Hawaiian barbeque chicken sandwiches with rice (which was pretty good). They also have the standard Residence Inn breakfast buffet in the morning with eggs, bacon/sausage, bagels, oatmeal, cold cereal, milk, coffee, and juices (they didn't have pastries for some reason). My kids loved the pool after a hot day at Sea World. Very relaxing before heading up to bed. The rooms were also very quiet at night, and we didn't here any of our neighbors. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have kids and want to stay close to the San Diego action. The freeway is very nearby, taking you to the Mission Bay area and to the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: alpLewes
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews here before I selected this hotel and it certainly met my needs. It is right up the road from Old Town and there you can make connections with the bus, train or even trolley. The mall is nearby along with other attractions. The room was clean and comfortable. I pick Residence Inn because it is a two room suite....I get up early, my partner does not and I can make coffee, read the paper and use my laptop. Breakfast was fine and the fitness room, although very small, was adequate...I was the only one ever in there. Disappointed that there is a daily parking rate, $10, which is high.

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: SJhulawahine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this Residence Inn. We had a kids suite room which consisted of a kids room (bunkbeds), the living/kitchen area and the master bedroom & bathroom. Location: Was really good for Seaworld. Only a short car ride over. I also like the fact that it's set up in the hills a bit, we didn't hear the traffic noise from the busy street. Room: Our room was clean upon arrival. The only cons were 1) one of the stove burners wasn't working and 2) there was a constant hum in the kids room, I believe from the elevator. It wasn't too loud but you could definitely hear it. My son didn't care though, he slept right through it. I know we had neighbors next door, only heard mumbling coming through the wall but couldn't make out the conversation. Misc: There's a complimentary breakfast that we took advantage of every morning. They had the standard waffles, pancakes, biscuits, sausage, eggs, bagels, toast, muffins, cereal, oatmeal and various drinks. The variety was great and we always walked away full. They also have a pool table, basketball court, small workout room and of course the swimming pool. Parking: As others noted is $10/day. The spaces are pretty tight too.

Reviews.Title: “This place is HORRID!”
Reviews.Author: Jenmisstx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night.. It was HORRID.. The place was dirty... The towels were dirty... I felt better off camping... We left and went to the HIlton La JOlla... Maybe it was just me but I expect better from a hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: traveler06
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in a 1 bedroom suite last week. Overall it was a good stay and I would stay again. Having a suite with a separate sleeping area and a bit of a kitchen is great with kids. We found the location great for going to attractions, restaurants, etc. You do need a car. the hotel is set up in a square with the pool in a courtyard in the middle. I agree with other posters that it can be confusing at first to get to the breakfast area and pool as the elevators don't go to all floors. I also agree with those that said the cupboard fronts are very dirty. The floor in our kitchen had a large sticky spot the entire time we were there. No WIFI in the rooms! Just in the lobby. Strange. And yes, parking is $10. Why? Other than those things, we enjoyed our stay and would probably stay here again. The beds were comfortable, shower worked well, the included breakfast was good and so convenient. There is a pool, kids pool and whirlpool that we used several times. We didn't have much interaction with the staff so I can't really comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break-it was okay”
Reviews.Author: wrigsassy
Reviews.Content: We were here over spring break at the end of March. Our first room was with a kid's suite that was right next to the elevator. Elevator was broken when we first got there but when it was going later that night it shook the entire kid's room. We all ended up sleeping in the one bed. We asked to be moved the next morning and they said all kids' suites are right by the elevator. We had stayed here the year before and had a kids suite that wasn't by the elevator but they said they had converted those. They didn't have anything available so we ended up in a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds for the entire week. First one they gave us smelled like someone died/got very sick in there and the windows were open so they were obviously airing it out. We asked for another one. Second one was fine. They said they would try to get us a two bedroom but we never heard from them again. One day our room was not cleaned until 6:00 and only after we called twice. Another day it was not cleaned until after 4. They would only put in 3 towels for 4 people every day so we had to ask for more. There are only 3 chairs in the rooms for the tables so you have to move the desk rolling chair over for our family of 4 to eat together. Room was clean except the outside of the cupboards were nasty. On the positive side, hotel was in a great location for us. Our kids loved the heated pool and the towels by the pool. Breakfast was crowded but good every day. Evening snacks were tasty and drinks were good. Staff was very nice. I would recommend this again if people did not want a kids' suite and they had a good discount.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tappaners
Reviews.Content: Our family just left San Diego last week and had the best time. We have an 8 & 5 yr old and stayed an entire week and had plenty to see & do. It was totally off season at all the local attractions so there were no lines at any of the parks. Stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn in Mission Valley with a heated out door pool, the kids were in heaven. This was a great place as they had a buffet breakfast every morning and Mon. thru Thurs happy hour for the adults free of charge. They upgraded our room on arrival( we do have a Marriott card) but def. did not expect that so that was an added bouns to get the kids suit. The hotel staff were so accomidating. The breakfast area had a great place for kids to keep busy while Mom & Dad could enjoy breakfast just a few feet away. As far as parks the best was the Wild Animal Park - a little farther outside San Diego but worth the trip to see animals in this natural setting. We go to the Bronx Zoo which is a large Zoo but to see animals in such a natural safari like setting was so amazing. Lego land was great for my kids age and being no lines they got to ride on everything and did so several times on the same ride due to the fact there were no lines. Sea World was also not crowded and we loved the Pets Show. My kids were a little old for the Elmo show but we did it anyway and they enjoyed it. The Stingray exhibit was awesome and my 8yr old went back a second time. Spending at least 15 mins petting them each visit. The Dolphins exhibit also amazing to be so close to these animals. Def. suggest you visit LaJolla being so close and check out the cove to see the Seals/SeaLions(I forget which they were). The cost line in LaJolla is also worth the visit alone. We ate dinner out everynight. Old Town is a must to get hand made torillas and eat out doors w/ heaters(if a chill). Leaving a snowy location to come to this was nice. We also checked out some local off beat reco's from Food Network and they were great- fish taco's at BlueWater- awesome- I'm still craving them. We left feeling -San Diego- a great place to live, not just visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good SD vacation location. Can't really walk anywhere though.”
Reviews.Author: germ
Reviews.Content: We had a good 4 night stay at the Residence Inn Mission Valley in SD. It was two adults and one 4 yr old in the room. Rooms: We had a king suite. Room was clean, and the king bed was comfortable. Having a full refrigerator, stove, and sink was a very nice feature and helpful when traveling with a kid. Free wired high speed internet in the room which was pretty fast. On the slightly negative side, the king bedroom was a little small side, there were no luggage stands in any part of the suite and we could hear dogs barking a couple of mornings (this is a pet friendly hotel). Not a big deal though. Hotel Facitilites: Free breakfast buffet each morning was good, about what you would expect from a hotel. We missed the evening reception that they have on some weeknights. Parking was $10 additional so factor that into your rate. The parking was gated and there was always plenty of empty spots to choose from. We didn't use the pools due to the weather, but they looked inviting nonetheless. The hotel is laid out a little strangely, so you have to walk outside in the middle courtyard to get to the lobby. Location: There is nothing to walk to from this hotel except other hotels, however it was right by the freeway so it was convenient to almost everything we wanted to do in San Diego. There are a couple malls w/stores, movies and restaurants reasonably close if you want to go somewhere nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs an update and is under staffed in the evenings”
Reviews.Author: deslaw
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent residence Inn customer and have stayed at many of their properties over the last 20 years. The staff who were on site were very nice and accomodating and even upgraded my room as I had stayed there a week earlier, I had noticed that they had only one staff member on site at night which caused me some concern from a security standpoint and for good reason. One night there were a number of young adults who had checked into the hotel and were having a party that went on past midnight. It. It took numerous calls to the front desk to get any action in part due to the lack of staff at night. First time in many years that I have experienced a lack of control from a security standpoint at a Residence Inn and made me feel quite uncomfortable as I have 3 young children . Furniture and bedding appears to be worn and need of replacement in the rooms . Overall the hotel was good value for me but they need to do a better job with evening security and update their rooms to merit a 4 or 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Centralized location and everything I needed”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDTraveler
Reviews.Content: OK, I'm a bit biased, as I am a Marriott Rewards holder and specifically love the Residence Inn brand. What can I say? I like free breakfast and having my own kitchen regardless of whether I end up using it or not. I used my rewards points for my stay, but also checked the online pricing, which was overall reasonable. Be advised that parking is $10 per night with in/out privileges. This isn't overall too bad price-wise as compared to staying in the Gaslamp Quarter, but if you were to stay a few miles down the 8, up the 5 or up the 163 parking would be free. I had a few complaints about this particular hotel: 1. My front stove burner did not work and a coffee carafe was slightly broken 2. The layout of the hotel is slightly confusing 3. There was only wired internet and no wifi. 4. I had to pay for parking As usual with Residence Inns, there is a business center and a workout room, as well as a basketball and a BBQ area. This hotel did have a larger pool area than usual with one large pool and two smaller pools. There is also a pantry area where you can buy some more groceries if you need to. This hotel seemed very family friendly (probably because its in Hotel Circle where most of the families go). There was a hotel reception (with free beer/wine) in the evenings, however, the snacks were all gone when I got there and there was a good 15 more minutes. Breakfast was good for a free breakfast with more than average hot items. There were biscuits and gravy, french toast, 4 do it yourself waffle stations, sausages, 2 types of scrambled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, sliced melon, grapefruit, cottage cheese, bagels/pastries/toast, and lots of beverage options (juice, coffee, hot cocoa, tea, soda and including the more unusual horchata and orange bang fountain drinks). The breakfast area was very crowded and the staff was on-task keeping the food replenished. I will say that it was quite a zoo even though the dining area was sufficiently large. The hotel was smart enough to be situated a bit closer to the hill and thus away from the freeway, so there was no noise. The room was nice and the bed firm and unmemorable (which is a good thing). Location-wise it can't be beat: close to downtown, balboa park, the zoo, gaslamp, sea world and Mission Bay. It is also very close to shopping at Fashion Valley and Mission Valley. The staff was nice, but did not allow me to extend my checkout time (which knocks them down one rating). I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would suggest it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn is great for families”
Reviews.Author: bestkidfriendlytrvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley the last week of August and found it to be the perfect home base for all the San Diego excursions. With a separate bedroom and full kitchens in the rooms, it's like having a condo with hotel amenities. Our 4yo goes to bed around 8pm and this way, I can stay up and watch TV, work online, hang out with the Husband, whatever, and not worry about waking up the child. Day one we spent checking in and exploring the hotel and surrounding area. The grocery store is one exit away and is near several fast-casual restaurants.. our favorite being Pei-Wei for kid-and parent-friendly Asian food. The hotel is also one exit (the other way) from historic Old Town San Diego with tons of shopping, restaurants, and the Old Town Trolley for tours. Day two we went to the San Diego Zoo... all of 10 minutes away with traffic. Day three we went to the Birch Aquarium and La Jolla Beach… again, about 10 minutes away. Days four and five we went to Sea World, 2 exits away on the way there, 1 exit away on the way home. Day six we drove down to Coronado Island and spent the day on the beach… about 15 min away. Every night we were home by 4-ish and spent some time in the pool. They say the pool is heated, but it feels like it’s heated by the sun, since by late afternoon the water’s pretty cool… and we only used the baby pool. We didn’t try the adult pool. (there were kids in there too, just better swimmers than mine). We also didn’t try the hot tub, but it looked inviting. Towels and noodles are provided at the pool area so you don’t have to use your room towels. Every morning there is a decent breakfast buffet… not as eye-popping as some of the other RI’s I’ve been in, but good variety none-the-less. There’s also a children’s section in the community area with only kid shows on TV, which my son liked. Dinner is served a few nights a week, but there’s too many good restaurants nearby to eat the bland food that is offered. However, it is kid-friendly food like spaghetti and meatballs, tacos, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families With Young Children”
Reviews.Author: LuvSHOes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn for two nights during Labor Day weekend. We chose the hotel for its price ($140/night during a holiday weekend), its proximity to Sea World and Balboa Park, and because it's a suite-style hotel. We've stayed at Residence Inns previously, and this particular location didn't disappoint. The best thing about the hotel are the rooms and the lobby area. The kitchen was very clean, fully stocked with utensils and dishes and glassware. The TV sizes and the Internet connection were excellent. The beds were pretty comfortable, although the bedroom was pretty cramped in size. The bathroom and vanity area were clean. The complimentary shampoo/conditioner/shower gel were of good quality. Our children loved the pool area. The temperature of the water was very cold, but it didn't deter most guests from jumping in. The pool towels were very threadbare, and the pool furniture was pretty dirty. They were minor irritants, however. The lobby is very large, with the standard adjacent dining area. This location has a cute kids' area with kid size stools and tables, and a TV for the kids to watch. The complimentary breakfast was not very good, compared to the other Residence Inn locations we've previously visited. The scrambled eggs were inedible, and the fruit didn't appear to be very fresh. However, there's always cereal/bagels/oatmeal as go-to choices, which helps keeps vacation costs down. The staff in the breakfast area wasn't very customer-service oriented, as I observed a few eye rolls in response to other guests' simple requests. The front desk staff, however, was very friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze. We also requested towels for our room, and they were delivered to our room literally within minutes. The front desk then followed up with a phone call to see if the towels had been delivered. Our room also wasn't cleaned while we were gone during the day, but a quick phone call to the front desk to request housekeeping to visit while we were headed out for dinner led to a thorough room cleaning during the hour we were gone. Again, another follow-up call from the front desk when we returned to ask if we were satisfied with the service. This is what we'd expect from a luxury hotel, so it was a nice touch. Finally, we were surprised by the parking fee ($14/night). We gladly paid a parking fee at our hotel on the beach, a few days earlier, as that's understandable. But at a hotel on Hotel Row? The fee's a transparent attempt to nickel and dime the guests, and was not appreciated. On balance, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel, it's not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: 6888deborah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #308, paid in excess of $200/night and were very disappointed with this hotel. Also, the location is not close to down town, shopping, restaurants, etc. It's only walking distance to other hotels. For everything else, you need to drive. It's about 20 minutes from down town San Diego. Here's what we experienced at the Hotel Circle South location: - Air conditioner was VERY loud and had to be turned off when we were sleeping. - I was unable to bath our children in a tub full of water because the plug wouldn't "plug" the tub drain. We called to the front desk, they were unhelpful. - There was no dish cloth, no "Do Not Disturb", no dish soap and the wine opener was broken. I asked house keeping to deliver these items--they didn't. - The shower curtain liner is cut crooked with scissors and it's too short and doesn't reach the tub. Each day I had to mop up the bathroom floor. - I asked for another floor mat for the bathroom, a new box of tissue, a new paper towel roll and a different flavour of coffee (there were two bags of the same flavour) but didn't receive any of it. - The door in the bedroom didn't stay closed as the hinges were sagging. When we lifted the door on the handle side, then it would latch. - The dishes in the hotel's dining room are plastic/paper. This does not jive with the hotel's efforts for the environment (re. the note in the bathroom about conserving on water and not laundering the towels each day). They do not have food/bar service except for breakfast and the occasional BBQ with frozen burgers/hot dogs. Gross. And last but not least I have tried to call House keeping twice to ask about a lost item and no one has called me back, despite assurances by the front desk that my messages will be returned. It's been about 5 days since my last message. Also, I the photos on the web site aren't the photos of this location. The pool, lobby, dining room and I believe the front entry are all taken of another hotel. I don't make a habit of thrashing good reputations, but this hotel was the pitts! The Anaheim Residence Inn was awesome though...I have left a great review for them. DP from Sechelt, BC

Reviews.Title: “Great location - No major complaints, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ABQLLV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Room was on the 5th floor facing the back of the property, with a view of a hill. We had a 1 bedroom suite with a living room/small kitchen with microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator. Bedroom was a little bit tight with 2 queens, but we did not spend much time there. It was nice having the living room area to hang out with the kids. We enjoyed the pool, hot tub and the free breakfast was better than expected. They also had nightly receptions on weekdays, where they served drinks and a light meal. Housekeeping was inconsistent, being there at 9am some days and 3pm on others, which would have been ok, but if you weren't ready for them exactly when they came, they skipped you for the day. We had 2 days without housekeeping, because one time we were still showering in the morning and the other day, getting ready for a dinner reservation when they came by and they never came back. There was only 1 elevator from the 5th floor down to the main floor and it was out of service for a day and a half, and one of the entrance parking gates was broken the entire trip, which was an inconvenience, especially since we were charged for parking. Hotel charged $10 a night for parking, which was a money grab by them pure and simple. They should not charge for parking. Some people avoided it by parking in the few spots on the driveway leading up to the hotel, which created some traffic problems and royally ticked off those of us who were paying for parking. Location was fantastic to Mission Beach, Sea World and Downtown. Would stay here again for the right price, but would also check out surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - if you can navigate the hotel property”
Reviews.Author: SueWSP
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with great amenities - except that there was no direct pathway from our room to the lobby and eating area. It is a large facility with multiple hallways and elevators and we usually ended up going out to the parking lot and walking around to the lobby door to get to breakfast or the happy hour. The staff was very helpful and the room was cleaned to perfection every day. Residence Inns are a great value if traveling for business or with family because of the kitchen and dining facilities in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: We-Travel-The-World
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many Residence Inns so we expected this one to be just as good as the others, unfortunately, it wasn't. The Pros – Nice setting with palm trees and a few flowers. Easy access to/from freeway. The Cons – Grungy bathtub. Carpet not laid nicely. There were ripples and there were a few times where we could have tripped. There was no place for suitcases in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, I would definately recommend to friends”
Reviews.Author: pandgmomma
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The staff could not have been more accommodating. We requested an early check in, and we actually got it!!! We requested a crib for our 6 month old, which wasn't in the room because of the early check in, but was delivered within 5 minutes of our arrival. The breakfast buffet was great, a little crowded, but good food, and everything was replenished promptly. The staff at this hotel made a very good impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: jaydog09
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but a little old looking and could use some updating. I was traveling with my husband ,a 4 yr old and a 6 yr old. The only real problem was the thin walls. We could hear EVERYTHING going on in the the hallway and above us. Usually this isn't such a big deal, but there was a newborn next to us, so it was diificult getting my kids to sleep. The breakfast was GREAT and worth the price of the room. They had eggs, waffles, pancackes, lots of hot food AND the cold items you expect. We would come back here

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: delcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Jan10-18/09 for a business&pleasure combined trip. Very friendly & helpful staff-eating area & cleaning staff always smiling & asking if you need anything. Our King suite was spotless & cleaned every day. They even did cute things with the towels (not towel animals) Stayed in Rm 307. View of the parking lot-who cares? I don't spend my days looking out the window. No matter where you stay in the hotel you will see either a parking lot or the pool area. A couple of problems-stained bathtub-appears to be water stains & also marks from rubber tub mat but no big deal. It was clean if not attractive looking & they can't be expected to replace everything that has a scratch or stain or ding right away. Do you replace everything in your home pronto if that happens? Me neither. Walls are VERY thin but I was only bothered by it one evening and it wasn't past 8pm. There seemed to be a party going on next door and they were playing a guitar. Never heard anything above or below us though. You hear people in the hallway outside your suite but doors closing & people talking don't really bother me. Unless you are the only person living in your house you hear these noises all the time anyway. The door separating the bedroom & living area wouldn't close since the bed was in the way! A quick call to the front desk & they came to move the bed over-problem solved! Also, every time we flushed the toilet, it made a strange sort of bell ringing noise. Not sure if it was audible to the people in the next suite or not. We didn't call to complain about it, though. If we had, I'm sure it would have been looked into. Plenty of storage in suite-a closet in bedroom & a closet next to entrance with an extra pillow, sheet set & blanket. Iron & ironing board & hair dryer. Dishwasher, 2 burner stovetop, fridge & microwave appear to be dated but we only used the fridge. There are also dishes, cutlery, pots, bowls, various utensils, and coffeemaker. You may not be able to cook Thanksgiving dinner for 20 but if you're a couple with a kid or 2, you will manage. If you plan to cook, I advise you to size up the kitchen & everything in it & plan your meals accordingly before heading to a grocery store. There is a store within a 10-15 min walk where you can buy liquor, beer, wine, toiletries, sunscreen, snackfoods, ready to eat foods, microwaveable food, books, magazines, lotto. There is breakfast every day which I think is from 7-9am or around there. The first day we were here the meat was corned beef hash but it was sausage for the rest of our stay. There was also scrambled eggs, cubed potatoes, biscuits, gravy, bagels, french toast, toast, waffles, various cereals, canteloupe & melon chunks, sliced peaches, cream cheese, jams, coffee, tea, milk, juices, soft drinks. A microwave nearby might be nice as the food can cool off quickly with everyone opening & closing the various containers. It can get quite busy during breakfast. There is plenty of seating & there are some free san diego union-tribune & USA Today newspapers available. From Mon-Thurs they have some food laid out from 5:30-7pm. On Monday there was fries, mac & cheese, chicken nuggets, mini corn dogs, salad, Tuesday it was nachos, refried beans, some sort of bean mix, I think, a tomato/onion/green pepper mixture, sour cream, salad, not sure what else, if anything, on Wednesday it was garlic bread, penne with alfredo sauce, penne with alfredo sauce & chicken, salad, parm cheese, on Thursday there was grilled hamburgers with ALL the fixings laid out, brown beans, potato chips, salad. During these evening they also had free wine & free Bud light draft beer although people were tipping the alcohol server. The cofee, tea, juices, milk & soft drinks were also available during these times. There are laundry facilities, a pool, 2 jacuzzis, a fitness room, a business area with 2 computers where you could access the internet, drinking fountains near the fitness room. The pool area is nice with tables & chairs outside should you want to eat. There is also a firebowl or whatever it's called outside which you can sit in front of. There are 2 large grills outside if you would like to BBQ your own food. We bought a couple of gallons of bottled water for $1.99 each at the store down the road as we didn't like the taste of the tap water at all. There are probably about 6 or 7 restaurants within a 15 minute walk but they seem to keep weird/irregular hours. A restaurant called Ricky's which is very close by is closed on Mondays & Tuesdays for renovations & we couldn't find a place open past 7pm other than the Tickled Trout. We ate there one night & it was okay-nothing special, that's for sure. It was very loud & they had Karaoke that night. The Fashion Valley Mall is a 25 min walk (at a very brisk pace) away. They have many great stores (check the web for a listing of them). A shopper's dream! There is a golf course across the road. There is a transit station next to the mall where you can get buses & light rail transit. The #14 bus runs along hotel circle south but I wouldn't rely on the times listed on the website. They def aren't accurate. Take a book/mag & some water to the bus stop with you. OR (this is sneaky I know but tip the driver a $1 to relieve your conscience) if the Old Town Trolley shuttle shows up before the bus which is usually the case, tell him you want to take the tour & they stop at the other hotels for passenger pickups along the way & then head to Old Town Park where the tour starts. Instead of taking the tour walk over to the Old Town transit center & get a bus or train to wherever you need to go. One of the drivers mentioned that the transit system company doesn't want the trolley drivers picking up 'their' passengers but the trolley drivers know the buses don't arrive as scheduled & they feel bad for the confused people waiting for the bus. I think if you act helpless & say you've been waiting a long time for the bus & really need to get to the old town transit centre, they might let you on the trolley. Tip them, though. Otherwise just walk to the Fashion Valley transit centre which will take 25-30 mins. We actually did pay for & go on the tour a couple of days later & it was a lot of fun. (1 day tour is $36) It's 2 hrs long but they have different stops along the way where you can get off & spend some time before getting on the next trolley that comes along. They come by designated stops every 1/2 hr. You can get off at the Midway, Seaport Village, Horton Plaza, Marriott Conv Centre, WH Davis House, Coronado, the Zoo & Balboa Park. We paid for the 2 day tour ($50)because we knew we would want to spend time at several stops. Coronado was my favorite. We went for a walk on the sandy beach which was so nice. We also walked around the town for a while. If you go to the zoo, take your own bottled water! A small bottle of water is $2.99 plus tax! I don't think they search your bags there. For a bottle of water and a tasteless burger & fries, I paid $12. If you go to Sea World, you can try bringing your own water. They do search your bags there & the sign says you can't bring coolers, thermoses, drinks & food in with you. I brought a tote bag and buried 2 bottles of water under my wallet & camera. It's fun to sit in the 'soak zones' at Sea World but you will get wet. Don't buy a rain poncho in the park (they cost $8). Pick one up at a dollar store or bring a towel with you. The prices of food seem a little more reasonable at Sea World compared with the zoo. At the zoo you get beer in a plastic cup for $6 & change...at Sea World it's in one of those aluminum sort of bottles for $5. I think so, anyway. I didn't drink but my significant other did. There is a bakery at Sea World with some great treats and the prices aren't too bad. There are also lots of other stands where you can buy various types of food and plenty of gift shops. The 'helicopter' ride at the Wild Arctic exhibit area is a lot of fun. We ordered pizza one night from the Florencia's menu that was on the table. We ordered the Giant pizza with 3 toppings and it cost $18 and change. It was really good. I wouldn't have minded trying some of the other selections. Local calls are .75 per call from the hotel. Parking is $10 a day. Some people seemed to park outside the gates along the driveway that led to the hotel. I don't know if they parked there overnight or if they were just 'guests of guests'. I know this review was very long and not all about the hotel but I hope it was helpful in some way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Pool; Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: caseysmiles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family (60+ year old mother, me (mid-30s) and son (age 5) for 5-nights. I travel often and try to stay exclusively at Marriott properties since I am a Silver member and enjoy getting the Continental frequent flyer miles. I had a great rate (using AAA discount) for a one-bedroom suite (with 2 queen beds) - $152/night - not including $10/day parking fee which I think is outrageous since you have no other parking options). The rooms at this Residence Inn could be updated but suited our purpose which was to have reasonably-priced and comfortable accomodations close to the sights in San Diego (max. 10-15 minute, easy drive to Coronado Island, the Zoo, Sea World, downtown San Diego and Old Town). We were also a 5-minute drive to a very upscale mall with every store imaginable, a large movie theatre, and several restaurants. The hotel is along a road off of whch several hotels sit but there are no good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and a car is a necessity. I rented a GPS from Avis (a Garmin Nuvi) and this was an invaluable resource for getting around the City. I highly recommend you invest in one or rent one if you are not familiar with the area. In terms of quality, I recently stayed at a newly-renovated Residence Inn in Chicago (near the Magnificent Mile) which was beautiful - very modern and chic. This facility cannot compare to that one in terms of furnishings, bedding, bathroom fixtures, etc. My arrival at this hotel was a bit bumpy. We arrived approx. an hour after the check-in time (which is 4:00) and our room was still not ready. After waiting approx. 30 minutes, I was given a room. We drove to the parking gate (you have to use your card to access the parking areas) and neither card worked. I returned to the reception area and was told the cards were working, but the cards were reactivated. Again, the cards did not work. As I was returning to the reception area, the manager was on her way outside to make sure the keys were working. To her credit, since I was very aggravated by this time, she helped carry our luggage into the room. Just after she left the room, I looked into the bedroom and realized we were placed in a suite with one king bed instead of two queen beds which is what I reserved. So, for the 4th or 5th time, I returned to the reception area and spoke to one of the agents (not the manager) who informed me that no other rooms were available that evening and we would have to stay in the room at least one night until another room became available. I asked to speak to the manager, the same woman who helped me previously and she was able to locate a kids suite for us to stay in (a two bedroom suite - one room with a king bed and the other with twin beds). We were able to stay in that room for the entire 5 days at the rate for the one-bedroom suite and the parking fee was waived. We had no other problems the remainder of our stay. The room was comfortable and clean and had everything we needed for our stay. My only complaint is that there is no door separating the sink area of the bathroom (which is located outside of the toilet and tub/shower) from the master bedroom. Therefore, you would disturb people sleeping in the master bedroom if you were using the sink. Also, even though we were in a kids suite, there was only one bathroom. Also, the heating unit in the kids' bedroom was loud at times. The pool area is wonderful and my 5-year old had a great time using it and the hot tub - as did many other families despite the chilly weather. I also used the laundry facilities which were clean and convenient - free detergent is available at the reception area. Breakfast is included with your stay which wasn't the best I have had at a Residence Inn, but had enough options that we are all satisfied (eggs, breakfast meat, potatoes, biscuits and sausage gravy, pancakes or french toast, cereals, fruit, yogurt, etc.). The reception area, which is clean and very large, also has a room with pool tables and an air hockey table; and two computers that are free to use. There is also a small arcade off of the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Way Over Rated-Sad Stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve063
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 8 days and could not get the room cleaned to save our lives. My wife complained at least 4 times. The maid would come in and change towels but never cleaned the mirrors or vacuumed. The rooms were on the small side for a suite and there was only 2 inches of clearance between the bed and door. In an emergency it would be hard to get out. In addition, the happy hours were not accurate as posted and they staff was rude at times. This was not a good bargain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CrazyinCA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located to everything we needed. In town for a concert in Chula Vista, we decided to stay in a more "touristy" area. Breakfast was really very good with plenty of seating. Staff was exceptionally friendly. Night time security guard was very nice. Paying for parking was ridiculous though. 10 dollars per night is way out of line. The spaces are tiny and parking pigs took up a space and a half so if you were to arrive back to the hotel late, you may not even find a parking spot. Taxes and all these extra add-on fees to the room seem crazy high. Convention fees/tourism fees. They sure seem to nickle and dime you here.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: gottogetaway2day
Reviews.Content: We read many reviews for San Diego area hotels before selecting the Residence Inn Mission Valley. Cleanliness and comfort for a good value is important to us. Our stay was 3 nights, 2 of those on the weekend. We wanted a comfortable place to lay our heads after busy days around the city. Our room was a very clean king suite with sofa bed. The mattresses on both beds were firm and the feather pillows a bit flat. We had requested extra and they were there upon arrival. There were 2 TVs which was great for the kids. Parking was included in our booking but will cost $10 per day in the lot. The spaces are small, perfect for compact cars. Continental breakfast with a french toast station and scrambled eggs. In our experience, the included breakfasts at most hotels are not great and this one met that expectation. If you like cereal and toast with a piece a fruit, it will work for you. We ate the breakfast one day, the eggs are tasteless but the french toast was pretty good. If you like to start the day with a good, healthy meal you should look for restaurants or utilize the kitchen in your suite. Sitting out by the pool with a cup of coffee or juice is a great way to start the day. We didn't use the pool however the area around it was clean and the pool appeared to be as well. We heard no traffic noise and none from surrounding rooms. We were on the 2nd floor near the stairs. It's very easy to access Old Town (visit the Old Town Mexican Cafe, it's awesome!), Sea World and not far from Coronado Island. This hotel met our needs and I would stay here again on a return trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Doonesbaby
Reviews.Content: Our family, (my husband and I, plus our four children aged 8, 10, 12 & 14) stayed in the Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley in mid-December 2007. The hotel is clean,comfortable and fully suited to longer stays for families with laundry, pool and BBQ facilities. Upon arrival, we were upgraded by the manager to a two bedroom suite, at no extra charge. Our excessive amounts of luggage were not regarded as a problem (ski gear etc), nothing was too much trouble for the friendly staff. The buffet breakfast was probably one of the best that I saw in our 7 weeks travelling in the US and Canada...and on the Thursday night of our stay, a buffet dinner and wine tasting was included for FREE. The hotel is well-located, very close to Sea World and SD Zoo. San Diego is a great city and the SD Residence Inn ensured that we will have fond memories of our time there for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Change for a Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: vaznayak
Reviews.Content: Not sure what folks are expecting this Residence Inn to be - the Ritz Carlton it ain't! And it ain't being sold as one! I have stayed at A LOT of Marriots, Courtyards and Residence Inns - Heck! I've done over 50 nights this year itself in Marriott hotels - and it's only August! This one is by far the best Residence Inn I've ever stayed at. Yes, if you're looking for a 'kidless' please, this isn't it. However, given that hotels in the vicinity are catering largely to SeaWorld crowds, this place clearly has it right. The entire entrance area, dining area, pool, are all brightly decorated, very well maintained, etc. While the breakfast is the regular Residence Inn stuff, the rooms are well appointed - and clean. I've stayed at full service Marriott Resorts that had worse appointed rooms. While some may find the fact that the hotel is a little removed from the main road is a bit of a pain, we actually is nice - an extra 50-75 yards from the main road isn't going to kill you - yes, even at $4/gallon of gas!!! Check in process and staff are polite, helpful and prompt. Anyways, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel - especially those with kids. If you're looking for peace and quiet, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddySantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY kid-friendly hotel. Tons of kids everywhere which is OK but our room could have been cleaner, some staff seemed very grumpy and the parking is murder. Parking spaces (parking is $10/day) are very small and fill up quickly. We mentioned our concerns to the Asst. Manager and he was very gracious but of all the Residence Inn's my family and I have stayed in, this was the least-enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “More than Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PickyParent
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 adults, 2 toddlers ages 4 and 2) spent 4 nites at the Residence Inn-Mission Bay based on the reviews I read on Tripadvisor. My first impression was that the hotel and our room was clean, bright and new. Our room was a 2 bedroom king with a kid's suite. The website advertises the kid's suite with bunk beds, but ours came with two separate twin beds. This actually worked out better since our children were probably too young for a bunk bed setup. The kitchen was well stocked with utensils and dishware. The stove top was missing the knobs for the burners. We didn't use the stove so it wasn't an issue (I assumed the knobs were somewhere in the drawers). The living area and masterbed room and bathroom were comfortable and again clean--which being new parents with toddlers was a great concern and major consideration on choosing a hotel for our first summer vacation. The second concern I had was how quiet the rooms are at nite--I'm a light sleeper and having 2 toddlers getting woken up by noise means no one would get any sleep. Luckily, even though you can definitely hear loud voices or pitter patter or feet running around, I think that since most of the guests were families traveling with kids there was hardly any commotion I hear after 10 or 11 o'clock when families are probably passed out. The hotel had a toddler pool (1 foot deep, ~10ft diameter), a main pool and a spa. We didn't use the hotel pool, but many guests did. The laundry facilities were modern which even uses low water front loader washing machines. The gameroom had pool tables, air hockey, foosball and few arcade games. There was a second gameroom which was small and not well air conditioned that had some older arcade games. The best features of the hotel were the complimentary hot buffet breakfast and the evening "dinner". The breakfast always had hot eggs (one basic scrambled and the other a variation like hame and cheese or spinach and mushroom etc), sausage or bacon, hot potatoes or beans, oatmeal, pancakes/waffles, several types of cereals and breads and variety of hot and cold drinks (milk, juice, coffee). The selection was great. At nite, the hotel had things like bbq hot dogs and hamburgers or spaghetti and meatballs. The dinners weren't 5 course meals, but great for something quick after a long day at Sea World or the Zoo and you can relax and eat by the pool. Overall the Residence Inn met my expectations on cleanliness, amenities, and staff professionalism. The only negative I can think of is that the buffet breakfasts can be crowded (I heard the weekends can be crazy) but the staff did a good job keeping up during our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other families and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nice, Convenient, Dismal Location”
Reviews.Author: writermomNewMexico
Reviews.Content: It's your typical Marriott Residence Inn, modern, tastefully decorated, clean, two room suite, kitchen, etc. Nice breakfast (despite the icky powdered eggs) well-stocked with plenty of seating and lots of food. Very kid-oriented with a cartoon area in the breakfast room, game room, kid floaties in the pool. Pool was packed with kids. In fact, all the guests seemed to be families with kids of all ages (uh, including us). Of course, there was the couple that came out of the elevator with six huge dogs on leashes...so I guess it's a dog-friendly place too. Staff seemed fine...those working on refilling the free breakfast buffet seemed to be working very hard. Front desk kindly printed driving instructions on how to get to the zoo, and then back to the hotel. The hotel layout is absolutely confusing...one part has four stories, the other part five, elevators and exits everywhere and once inside the building we seemed to completely lose all sense of direction. Having to pay for parking is appalling...though typical of most San Diego hotels, this is particularly galling at this establishment because there is no where else to park except for the parking lot (gated, with access by using your room card). Hotel Circle is a dismal freeway frontage road of chain hotels and motels. Not the sort of place you'd want to take an evening stroll. We had to drive to find someplace to eat and stumbled upon a satisfying King's Seafood in a nearby strip mall. True, there was a place called Ricky's, an older diner about a five to ten minute walk from the hotel. We had to walk past a fenced-in, boarded-up, failed spa business, and overgrown weed-filled, vacant lots filled with trash and empty liquor bottles to get there. We stayed for two nights because my husband was attending a conference at a nearby hotel. The location, despite being dismal, is a short drive to Balboa Park, Old Town, etc. It took about ten minutes to get to the zoo via the nearby freeway. Still, Hotel Circle is pretty soulless, and well, depressing. The hotel itself was fine.

Reviews.Title: “'No Worries' Here !!!”
Reviews.Author: tkbocl
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed here 5 nights as part of our San Diego trip and we could not have been more pleased. To keep things short, here's the summary.... -clean rooms with plenty of space and full kitchens -super quiet -friendly, efficient, helpful staff -great breakfast with some daily variety -super clean pool, hot tu, and kids play pool -nice evening reception (M-Th) -feeling of security -less than 15 minutes to almost everything -easy on/off highway We usually stay at ES, but this place was awesome! As they say in SoCal, "No worries."

Reviews.Title: “Tired...”
Reviews.Author: sandyjeff
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is "off the highway" which after driving two hours from Anaheim, made me a little nervous. But on the plus side of its location, it is very close (10 mins. or less) to Historic San Diego (not the Gaslamp Dist.) and of course highway access is a breeze. It is set pretty far back from road and noise or activity level were never an issue. Okay - we were put in a Handicap room (seemingly because we arrived in the late afternoon). The room seemed to be smaller than other Res. Inns. The interior is dated and a little worn. The shower is NOT one of those wall-less handicap showers that lets water go everywhere though. There is no closed closet - no bigg-y. And the volume on the dated TV's is picky. The breakfast is a free-for-all. It was so busy but they have a sign that indicates that they restock btwn. 9:15 - 9:30. And they do. It has what you would expect - powder eggs, fruit, oatmeal, breads, drinks, etc. We paid more for this hotel for two nights that we did for four nights at a Marriott Suites in Anaheim. (We got a screamin' deal there). Admittedly we were not there for its ammenities and again the location (convenience wise) couldn't be beat. But it's too bad they can't put a little money towards making it a slightly nicer retreat for travel, park weary families.

Reviews.Title: “Good nights rest”
Reviews.Author: wifam4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night during our 10 day Southern California Vacation. Good location to get to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo, easy access on/off freeway. One bedroom suite had plenty of room, comfortable beds. Breakfast Buffet with good selection of foods with some heathy options. Front desk staff casual, helpful. Marketplace to get soda and ice cream. View from room limited (faced a sidewalk and wall near pool), noise not a problem. Parking in a gated lot, location appeared secure.

Reviews.Title: “This worked out great for us”
Reviews.Author: LSWOrem_UT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the U.S. Open last week. The location is really central to almost anything. The one bedroom worked out well for us. We thought the breakfast each day had an excellent variety and we ate there every morning for a week. The rooms and grounds are well maintained. The pool is clean and well cared for. The staff members were especially attentive and all of our needs were met. The promotions for the golf tournament were fun too.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aerochik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel after getting off of a 5 day cruise....we had previously booked a room at a different hotel that turned out to be a huge disappointment and we cancelled immediately upon checking in and seeing our room. The Residence Inn turned out to be EXACTLY what we were looking for as a nice treat for our last night on vacation!!! The room was very clean, had a nice view of the mountainside, was very large and comfortable.....ideal for what we were looking for!!! The dining room was a little bit crazy for breakfast - but the food was good. Would totally stay here again and recommend it to any of our friends and family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to SeaWorld, great for families”
Reviews.Author: grantwriterguy
Reviews.Content: First, I want to commend TripAdvisor on the usefulness of their site. Last year we took the family (two kids 5 &7) to the #1 rated Disneyland hotel, The Candy Cane Inn, and it was everything the reviews (the positive ones) said. This year we booked the Residence Inn near Sea World and once more the reviews were accurate. For a family with young children, this was a great choice. While we were checking in, staff asked if we would like to have our children stay and play in their "Munchkin Minders" area, an ongoing program that offers supervised crafts and games to kids. The pools and spa were also great for the kids. The one hitch we had was our room wasn't quite ready and we had to move to one next door that was - after having put away half our stuff. Management gladly waived our parking fees, 20 dollars over two nights. Fair enough. I would happily return, and I know my kids would too.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Confident to Stay at the Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: travelbeth
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom suite. Beds were very comfortable. Shower had great water pressure. Cute kitchen but we didn't really use it. Breakfast buffet--FANTASTIC!! Scrambled eggs (the real thing), pancakes, belgium waffles, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, hash browns, juices, GREAT coffee with the flavored creamers. Juice, coffee and treats available all day in the lobby. There is a 'kid corner' with small tables and chairs and a tv with cartoons on for the kids. Pool was heated, jacuzzi was relaxing. Towels provided although most were small/kid sized. Basketball court in front of the hotel, pool tables and game room were fun. Neat courtyard area for relaxing out by the pool. Two computers in the lobby area, one hooked up to a printer. That's a plus for those who need to print out their airline boarding passes the day before. Only complaint was the housekeeping wasn't done til later in the afternoon. Location was great...close enough to drive into the city and about a mile from Old Town. Would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: Megstravel38
Reviews.Content: At first I was unsure about the hotel because I saw it was right by the freeway. However the drive way was further back from the freeway, so it helped with the noise of traffic. It was only a minute away from old town, easy to access sea world and everything else you needed. The breakfast in the morning was amazing, really good food. There is also a big swim area and a small fitness center and game room. Really clean, spacious rooms, with full kitchen and office desk area. I never heard noise from other guests nearby. I will stay there again sometime in the future, maybe during the week to save money!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best deals of the year for families with small children!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty-2004
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel/motel that has tried so hard to please. The staff can't do enough to make you feel at home (Away from Home). We just returned from a family vacation of 7 days at the property. We had the 2 bedroom over looking the pool to keep an eye on the young ones and parents. The other room we had was a one bedroom. There were 6 adults and 3 small children 1,3, and 4 ages. They called several days ahead to find out about our reservation and if we had any request. I ask to have easy access to unload and come and go to the pool area. Our request was honored. Note we were there during spring break so no real price break but have to say if was fair for what we had. The only bad point and it had mentioned before was the thin walls.We were woke up to mornings at 5:15 AM 2 mornings and the bathroom could have been updated a llitle. Enjoy this place it is a gem. The location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spring Break Family Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: juicygirlfruit
Reviews.Content: After a fun day at the San Diego we a family of 5 (2 kids grandma, hubby & myself) fchecked in for 1 night during Spring Break 3/2008. We had a nice corner room with a view of the roof (blah), but it was quiet and rarely ever heard a peep from outside noise. There is a kitchenette, dining area, pull-out sofa bed and separate bedroom w/ 2 queen beds. It was ample size but the bathroom was plugged up and we arrived. It took the maintenance men a while to arrive & service the bathroom, but they were nice and repaired the toilet. The room is clean, decent, needs just a bit of painting. The beds were fine, but more "heavenly" type of pillows would have been nice. The kids & daddy enjoyed the warm pool & jacuzzi. During the weekdays there are happy hour theme nights and we ate Mexican that evening and didn't even have to go out for dinner. Also included was free beer, wine & soda for 2 hours. The breakfast buffet was more than ample for our family. Plenty of variety from cereal to hot waffles & sausauges. Close to the Zoo, Sea World, Downtown, Coronado Island, etc....The next day we drove out to Balboa park and took the kids to the Science Museum (a good deal for $30 for the 4 of us w/ the AAA discount...grandma sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful weather. We also toured the free arboretum & one museum of Renaissance art (which was also free). Then we ate at our favorite & inexpensive seafood restaurant downtown Anthony's. Good food, wonderful view & very reasonable for lunch and/ or dinner. We later took a drive to Coronado Island and it was just gorgeous. Overall, good experience & all for under $200 for one night for a family of five at the Residence Inn Marriot San Diego Mission Valley. Will stay there again for convenience & price...although I had to pay $10 for parking where in the past it was free!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoosierTraveler28
Reviews.Content: I've made several trips to the San Diego area and have stayed downtown, at the airport and on Coronado Island. This hotel is now my first choice when travel to San Diego. The staff is great, the rooms are clean, the breakfast and supper are outstanding and the exersize facility is adaquate. There are plenty of common areas including the gate house, an arcade, pool area with grills and a pool room. The hotel has a quiet atmosphere and is close to several restaraunts. It is only a short drive to Old Town and down town San Diego. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near Sea World, Restaurants and alot of shopping”
Reviews.Author: smjplove06
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a month ago for business. Very peaceful, and clean room. The staff was very nice and I have to admit that the free breakfast and free dinner/snack was decent. If you have kids, there is a clown of some sort that comes around and gives the kids balloons and there is a small kid area for the kids to eat and play in the eating area. There is a shopping outlet about a mile away from the hotel and a regular shopping mall a mile away from the hotel. Several restaurants around the hotel, and tons of Mexican restaurants in the Mission Valley area. One of my co-workers did get his rental car broken into in Misson Valley State Park parking lot at 1:30pm in the broad daylight and his GPS was stolen. I didn't encounter anything like that but to keep your car safe, take out your personal belongings. I would go back here and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a lot for the money!”
Reviews.Author: DelUk
Reviews.Content: Could not resist the offer of a 1 bedroom suite, with full kitchen, hot breakfast for $129 per night. We were not disappointed. We arrived and checked in and went to our allotted room. OH NO, it was filthy.... it had not been cleaned yet, and had obviously had some pretty untidy people staying. Not to worry rang reception. Housekeeper came up immediately with a key for an uprgraded 2 bed suite with kids room. Wow good quality, 3 tv's one in each room. dishwasher, fully functional kitchen, the maid will wash up for you if you choose to use anything in the kitchen. They will even shop for you at no extra charge! It was not necessary to cook however as they had a huge buffet breakfast of good variety in the dining area at front of hotel. Every afternoon/evening there was a 'manager's hospitality' session with free food and drink laid on. If you wanted you could have made a meal of it. There was also free drinks, fruit and snacks in lobby all day long. No need to buy any food at all f you were that way inclined, but with all the lovely restaurants in Old Town (about 2 miles by car), it would be a shame not to eat out. A useful free service at this hotel was that anwhere you wanted to go, reception would print out directions there and back. True this hotel is on hotel circle (rows of hotels either side of freeway), so you really need a car to get anywhere, but it is only 10 -15 minutes from Seaworld, 5 from Old Town, with it's links to San Diego's excellent public transport system. The pool was beautifully warm even in December, loads of free towels. The car park had security barrier. My kid just loved the kids bunk room, he felt really at home in there. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this Residence Inn!”
Reviews.Author: AquaMom
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to stay here given some of the past reviews, but we are glad we decided to try this property. We will stay there again next year. We stayed for five nights after Christmas. The one-bedroom suite was the same layout as rooms in other newer Residence Inns, but the living/kitchen area was much bigger. The bedroom area was a bit tight though. It is too bad some of the living/kitchen area was not used instead for the bedroom area. The one big negative, which is mentioned in other reviews, is the lack of adequate soundproofing in the room. One night I woke up and nudged my husband, telling him he was snoring. Come to find out, my husband was not snoring. Instead, it was the man in the room next to ours. Later that night I awoke again to the snoring of that man and my husband and son! The next morning, that man started singing at 4:30 a.m., and I could have sung right along with him because I could hear all the words.... The bed, though, was very comfortable, as I have found all of the Residence Inn beds to be. The only other negative was some difficulty we had with the card key reader at the outside door - it sometimes wouldn’t read our card, which left us locked out of the building at inopportune times. Our toilet was malfunctioning at one point, but the maintenance man showed up right after we called the front desk. We were on the first floor, so I cannot speak to the inconvenience of the elevator layout. My son, a huge Shamu fan, was thrilled to see the huge Shamu statute in the lobby. While he was playing around it, the General Manager started talking to him and generously gave him a beanie baby killer whale! The front desk staff was very helpful, pleasant, and efficient. Our check in and out were very fast. Having spent so much time at SeaWorld, which is less than ten minutes away by car, we did not get to use the pool area, but it looked very clean. The entire property, including our room, was very clean too. The property is conveniently located on Hotel Circle. I did not find the area to be so run-down as described by other reviewers. Sure, some of the nearby properties are older, but I did not feel unsafe, even with a small child. We had no trouble finding grocery and other stores nearby. The front desk gave us great printed directions. The parking spaces are very tight, and it is unfortunate that there is a daily $10 charge for the privilege. Some of the vehicles these days are just so big - one morning it was nearly impossible for us to open the door to our rental car and squeeze inside. The breakfast buffet was very extensive and typical of other Residence Inns (rotating hot items such as eggs, sausage, hash, pancakes, and the usual waffle station, plus breads, bagels, donuts, fruits, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc.). There was even a woman who came around with a beverage cart. We saved some money by having a AAA card. The difference in the room rates has more than paid for the membership. In sum, we were very pleased with our stay and plan to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at Residence Inn Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: chittty
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn Mission Valley is in a very convient location on Hotel Circle, easy access to highways, shopping, downtown, Hillcrest neighborhood and attractions. Room was clean, beds were comfortable, free wireless internet and parking. Staff were helpful and breakfast and managers receptions were all all good. I had a government rate so the rate was very reasonable. I was attending a conference at the Town and Country convention center and was very glad I choose to stay at the Residence Inn rather than at the Town and Country based on comments from others who were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mikeatla
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and decent. Its a condo style accomodation. The hallways and interior needs to be changed though. The staff were excellent. The complimentary wifi and hot buffet breakfast is wonderful. The only thing i can comment on the property was that on their website they said they have a heated pool, but when we were there and used the pool, it was sunday morning right after breakfast , the water temperature was freakin COLD. They tried to turn the heater on but unfortunately, we need to check out so we havent tried how heated was their pool will be. Overall it was a pleasant stay and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feeling”
Reviews.Author: milkenit
Reviews.Content: First i would like to say that it is a new hotel, i have tried to only stay at residence inn hotels for more than 10 years now, i'm a big fan. I grew acustomed to the seperate and quiet bungalow style rooms that the older hotels offer, kinda gives you an at home feeling, well this hotel doesn't offer that style of rooms or feeling, it's one of those drag your bags for what seems like forever to an elevator down the hall and around the corner type feels, and with a family of four, plan on making trips. The rooms are very nice, full kitchen, and this hotel isn't short on amenities very nice pool, even though they say the pool is heated it isn't, anyone with small kids the wading pool is an excellent idea, the full breakfast is great, great staff. FREE internet NOW(used to cost 10 bucks a day) my only other gripes are the $10.00 bucks a day for parking. I could possibly see that if it was an open or shared parking lot, but it's a HOTEL ONLY private parking lot, so 10 bucks a day and anywhere from $180.00 bucks and up a night for a room,( i'm not a greedy or cheap person, paying that much i think that reflects that, there are plenty $60-$80 hotels all around this place) one would think the small amenities like the internet access (since they mostly cater to the business traveler) and DEFINITELY A NECESSITY LIKE PARKING YOUR CAR would be included, and last but not least the A/C. I don't know about all of you who reads this but to me A/C is a comfort, and it definitely helps me sleep better, well the selling point of most hotels is "come on in,and get a good quiet nights rest", well i don't know if this is a designer's flaw, or a marketing plot to keep their light bill down, but the main A/C operator(the one usually hidden in closets that you can't see or hear) well at this hotel it's located in the wall at the very foot of your bed(yes in the bedroom) so it's very disruptive and almost impossible to sleep with, therfore you will turn it off to go to sleep, thus resulting in lower operation, thus lower light bill (you be the judge) and you can hear the TV and people faintly talking in the next room over,but these are my only few disappointments. Now with this you may call be a whiner but i would like it if they transition like the other hi-end hotels and go to the nice flat plasma TV's. I would stay here again because i'm a long time fan, but i would first check for an older location near by first, the A/C is a real disappointment. Seaworld, zoo, downtown, and great restaurants are very close by making it a plus for location. YES i would recommend this hotel to anyone whom could look past my gripes about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: HP33
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a great find! The rooms are wonderful, we stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite which was very comfortable, clean and homey. The staff was friendly and patient and the continental breakfast was excellent. The pool area is fantastic. And the hotel's location is very close to Old Town. I had one snag in forgetting my phone charger in the room. After a staff miscommunication on it's whereabouts I was immediately sent a replacement. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, could be better”
Reviews.Author: CADiesel310
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay at Residence Inn. The room accomodations and amenities offered were great except for a few complaints such as bad internet connection, the bedroom door was blocked by the bed, the headboard on the bed was a noisy when doing the wild thing, and the parking availability was ridiculous. None the less, the pros outweighed the cons. I'd stay here again. if it was our last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Stay # 2 - We have issues!!!”
Reviews.Author: SummerTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Having written a lengthy review one year ago that chronicled some problems with this particular hotel, I hoped that we could find another hotel for this summer's San Diego vacation. However, with 4 free nights from our Marriott Rewards Visa (for a 2 bedroom suite w/bunkbeds @ over $300/night), my wife and I couldn't resist another attempt. After spending 4 days in Los Angeles, we drove down to San Diego and checked in. That went smoothly, and the manager, Tom (I believe) was very accomodating. We did request a room that was on an upper floor and facing outward toward the parking lot, since the noise from the pool kept us awake last summer (all rooms either face inward toward the pool or outward). When we entered our upstairs room, we were immediately greeted with a horrible smell. It smelled like something from the beach had died there! Since the room was warm, we thought that the air conditioning would remedy this problem, so we unpacked our 8 suitcases. Upon our return from a day of fun the following day, the smell again overtook us. Long story short... they had maintenance come up on 3 different occasions (once, the maintenance worker stuck a "STICK UP" behind our TV), and finally admitted that they were having problems with a drain in the building. Even the hallways smelled. In fairness to the hotel staff, they did, however, offer to move us, but with so much luggage already unpacked, we suffered through it. As far as the rest of the hotel, the breakfast was fine, as usual. Belgian waffles, eggs, pastries, oatmeal, fruit, etc... The manager's reception Mon. - Thurs. was okay, too. Nachos one night, burgers/dogs another, Mexican one night, and fettucine/salad, as well. This allowed us to save some money, and they had mac and cheese for the kids. Housekeeping did an okay job, all of the employees were very friendly, the pool was nice and this year, our plan to cut down on the noise from the paper-thin walls worked (stay on the 4th floor if you can - that way, you only have neighbors below you). Overall, it is a very family-oriented hotel. Remember, though, request an upstairs room that faces out toward the parking lot - it may cut down on noise.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyButt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located pretty far from all the good stuff in San Diego, so beware. Actually, there isn't much around except for other hotels. There are a couple restaurants around, but you definitely need to drive there. They charge you $10 a day for parking here, which seems ridiculous since you're already paying over $200 a night. The actual rooms are nice and clean, but fairly small. The rooms have their kitchenettes with microwave, fridge, stove, and dishwasher. The free breakfast isn't all that it's cracked up to be, either. The only real "hot" food item was the waffles that you make yourself. I think they had some scrambled eggs, but by the time I got there... nothing was left. Overall, I wasn't very impressed with this place considering it's pretty expensive. I would have been just as happy staying at a nice Motel 6 or something that was closer to all the cool stuff in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: baco4
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here from 9-22 June. I was concerned after reading the reviews. It was one of the nicest stays that we've ever had. The rooms were nice, the staff did everything they could to make our stay nice. Everyone was super friendly. The manager and staff should be applauded in every way. The evening manager's reception a.k.a dinner saved us a ton of money. Breakfast buffet is super. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business May 22-24. First of all the hotel is not in the best of locations. The hotel is situated among a ton of run down motels. Looks like this area was developed in the 60's/70's. Next time I go back I will stay closer to downtown. This is a newer Residence Inn, but they must have constructed it very cheaply. The walls are very thin. Since this is a family vacation type of hotel, people are up at the pool/bbq area/hallways during all hours of the night. Do not stay here if you need a quite night of sleep. Also, the elevator situation is weird. You have to take multiple elevators to go all the way to the 5th floor. My other complaint is that the hotel staff seemed a bit unprofessional. Not what I'm used to when I stay at Marriot properties.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back, not what we expected for a Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: CACALovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an overnight stay. Our two room suite was $350, which is a little steep for the size of the suites. It was very difficult to navigate through the hotel, because one elevator only goes to floors 2-5, then you have to take a different elevator to the 1st floor. The hallways were noisy at 1am, with people in the halls and elevators. During breakfast, because the hotel was sold out that weekend, the staff was a little slow keeping butter, bread, etc. stocked. The toaster machine was not working properly, so as a result I had to stick my hand all the way to the back to retrieve the toast and burned my hand on the machine. This is very dangerous considering how many people were using this toaster overn.
